title: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis is uninjured after being involved in a car crash
description: The Republican presidential candidate and his campaign team were traveling to an event in Chattanooga, Tenn., when traffic backed up, causing a four-car crash.

title: Phoenix melts in a record streak of days over 110 degrees. And it's not over yet
description: Tuesday marks 26 consecutive days in Phoenix, Az. with a temperature over 110 degrees, and it doesn't look like it will let up any time soon.

title: Biden's dog, Commander, has been biting Secret Service agents
description: The conservative group Judicial Watch obtained Secret Service emails complaining about Commander being aggressive. One bite sent an agent to the hospital.

title: Speaker McCarthy says the House may launch an impeachment inquiry of President Biden
description: The House speaker says Republicans may launch an impeachment inquiry into President Biden. House GOP members have been investigating allegations of financial misconduct related to his son, Hunter.

title: Marine veteran Trevor Reed was wounded fighting in Ukraine
description: The U.S. Marine veteran was freed from Russian prison in a prisoner swap last year. Now he has sustained an injury while fighting in Ukraine, the State Department said.

title: Ammon Bundy ordered to pay $50 million. But will the hospital ever see the money?
description: A jury as ordered Ammon Bundy and an associate to pay more than $50 million in damages to Idaho's largest hospital after armed protests last year led to a security lockdown.

title: A political gap in excess deaths widened after COVID-19 vaccines arrived, study says
description: After vaccines became widely available in 2021, "the excess death rate among Republican voters was 43% higher than the excess death rate among Democratic voters," Yale researchers say.

title: TikTok's new text post format is similar to, but not the same as, Threads and Twitter
description: The new publishing option, which was announced Monday, will allow content creators to combine written content with music, stickers and hashtags.

title: Judge blocks Biden administration's new rules for asylum-seekers at the border
description: U.S. District Judge Jon Tigar blocked a similar policy during the Trump administration, and immigrant advocates had urged him to do the same in this case.

title: UPS union calls off strike threat after securing pay raises for workers
description: A tentative agreement between UPS and the Teamsters has averted a potential strike at the company. The deal will secure pay raises for part-time workers.

title: Bronny James, LeBron's oldest son, suffered cardiac arrest during practice
description: The incoming freshman at the University of Southern California was at basketball practice Monday when he suffered a cardiac arrest, according to multiple media reports.

title: A former pastor is charged with murdering an 8-year-old girl nearly 50 years ago
description: David Zandstra, 83, has been charged with criminal homicide, first-degree murder and other crimes. Investigators say he admitted to killing Gretchen Harrington in 1975.

title: China has replaced its foreign minister, absent from public for a month
description: China is removing its foreign minister, Qin Gang, and reappointing his predecessor, veteran diplomat Wang Yi, to fill the position.

title: Obamas' personal chef dies while paddleboarding in Martha's Vineyard
description: The body of Tarfari Campbell, 45, was recovered Monday after a two-day search in Edgartown Great Pond, near a home owned by the former president and first lady.

title: Up First briefing: Climate worsens heat waves; Israel protests; Emmett Till monument
description: A study finds climate change is making heat waves worse. Protests erupted in Israel after the government passed a law to weaken its judiciary. Biden will designate a national monument for Emmett Till.

title: Kurtis Blow breaks hip-hop nationally with his 1980 debut
description: Hip-hop is celebrating its 50th anniversary this year. Commentator Kiana Fitzgerald is looking back at the albums that changed the game.

title: When illness or death leave craft projects unfinished, these strangers step in to help
description: It can be heartbreaking to let go of a hand-made rug or sweater that a loved one didn't quite finish. A group of volunteer knitters, quilters and other crafters offer some closure.

title: U.S., European heat waves 'virtually impossible' without climate change, new study finds
description: Punishing heat waves have gripped America, Asia and Europe this July. A new study finds human-caused climate change is a major reason why.

title: Congregations leave United Methodist Church over defiance of LGBTQ bans
description: The largest mainline Protestant denomination in the U.S. is shrinking due to disputes over LGBTQ+ clergy and same-sex marriage. About 20% of United Methodist congregations have left in recent years.

title: In 'Someone Who Isn't Me,' Geoff Rickly recounts the struggles of some other singer
description: Rickly's first book is a solid and promising literary debut. He's a natural, albeit a germinal one. He is best known as a singer and songwriter of the rock band Thursday.

title: Netflix's pop-up eatery serves up an alternate reality as Hollywood grinds to a halt
description: The new restaurant runs on star power from the streaming giant's unscripted programs. Dining there feels surreal, as striking writers and actors have brought the movie and TV industry to a standstill.

title: Wildfires across Algeria have killed at least 2 dozen people
description: Wildfires across Algeria have killed 25 people, including 10 soldiers trying to get the flames under control in the face of high winds and scorching summer temperatures, government ministries said.

title: An American becomes the youngest to debut in the Women's World Cup — for South Korea
description: Casey Phair of New Jersey, 16, came in late in the second half for South Korea in its match against Colombia to make her World Cup debut.

title: A former Northwestern volleyball player is suing the university over alleged hazing
description: The former volleyball player is the first female athlete from the university to sue over recent hazing. It's the latest lawsuit over alleged hazing in the school's athletic programs.
